alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 04 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Increased River Flows and Flooding due to Snowmelt... A weather system moving into the area today into Friday will cool temperatures and bring scattered rain showers to Lincoln County. The light rain is not expected to be a major contributor to flooding at this time. Despite the cooling temperatures, rivers and streams are expected to continue running high as warm temperatures have melted much of the valley and foothills snowpack, which is making its way into the main stem rivers. Local emergency management reports widespread low-land flooding near the Bear River and Salt River, with smaller tributary streams running high as well. Currently, flooding is mainly affecting low-lying agricultural areas. Streams are generally expected to rise further into the day Friday, after which time flows are expected to level off, but remain high through the weekend. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain, there are hundreds of low water crossings which can be affected by increased stream flows. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
